text.para: Comments starts with a #, and Python will ignore them

list.item: Comments can be used to explain Python code.
Comments can be used to make the code more readable.
Comments can be used to prevent execution when testing code.
Comments can be placed at the end of a line, and Python will ignore the rest of the line
A comment does not have to be text that explains the code, it can also be used to prevent Python from executing code
Python does not really have a syntax for multiline comments.To add a multiline comment you could insert a # for each line

editor.title: Example
editor.syntax: #This is a comment print("Hello, World!") print("Hello, World!") #This is a comment #This is a comment #written in #more than just one line print("Hello, World!")
